column4: I will do anything if someone could help me simply boot into my computer.

Here's my problem: after I installed recommended ubuntu automatic updates, it completely effed up grub and now I can boot into ubuntu or windows. It was handling two partitions on the same drive, dual-booting. I desperately need to simply be able to boot into my computer.
I've edited my menu.lst file in grub to theoretically allow me to boot into windows, but it gave me an error when I tried that.
You probably botched your menu.lst. pastebin it
Give me one sec. Logging on to livecd
And what error would be useful as well.
What was the error? The same thing?
It should fix both. Because if your menu.lst has Ubuntu booting from hd(0,1) which.
Yea you did. :D
Theres nothing in my menu.lst for ubuntu though. Windows is now my only option.
Right, because you commented it out. Look right below the Windows boot entry (if you can)
Fine, the system did, either way.
It is currently commented out, so uncomment it, change the root assignement on the Ubuntu entry and you should be set.
I don't even have /dev/hda2
Well, I mean, try it.
And if it doesn't work, we can figure out why.
hd(0,1), smart stuff
You don't wipe with penguin-friendly TP
http://dpaste.com/82003/
You can use root hd(#,#) in place of that UUID stuff
Like this http://dpaste.com/82005/
Computer Goblins.
